search_results.snippet:
A frying pan, frypan, or skillet is a flat-bottomed pan used for frying, searing, and 
browning foods. It is typically 200 to 300 mm (8 to 12 in) in diameter with 
relatively low sides that flare outwards, a long handle, and no lid. Larger pans 
may have a small grab handle opposite the main handle.
